fullText: This sumptuous revival of the Lerner and Loewe musical treats the material with the reverence due a classic, while making some subtle but meaningful adjustments to Shaw's stubbornly retrograde sexual politics.
dtliExcerpt: This sumptuous revival of the Lerner and Loewe musical treats the material with the reverence due a classic, while making some subtle but meaningful adjustments to Shaw's stubbornly retrograde sexual politics.
bwwExcerpt: If you've got it, flaunt it. The splendid Beaumont stage at Lincoln Center was made for great classic musicals like Lerner and Loewe's 'My Fair Lady,' and helmer Bartlett Sher was born to stage them. This jubilant revival is meticulously mounted and entirely welcome - despite the eccentric casting choice of Lauren Ambrose as Eliza Doolittle.
